page.title: 11RUDGWICK VILLAGE-HISTORICAL
page.content: Of places,features and buildings with- in Rudgwick,the following are{HISTORI- {CALLY}interesting:{HOLY TRINITY CHURCH - the{MAJORITY}of this{PARISH}building dates back to the{14th C.}which is un- usual as very little church building occurred in{SUSSEX}during this{ERA.}In addition the church's{ORGAN}is famous for,when necessary,it can be{OPERATED with its{HAND-PUMP.}A{CONGREGATION}of} {APPROX 130}can be seated. In contrast the{VILLAGE CHAPEL}opened in{1826,}was {160}years old in{1985}and can seat a congregation of{150+.}For the past{10 {YRS}the chapel has provided a{NON-CON- {FORMIST}form of{WORSHIP.}At the bottom of Church Hill{(\km from the church) lies the old{VILLAGE HALL.}This little hall was built in{1897}to{COMMEMORATE} the{DIAMOND JUBILEE}of{QUEEN VICTORIA. Its primary function is as a{NURSERY {SCHOOL}and for{HIRE}by village{CLUBS.
